question.text: Identify the type of root given in the figure, from the given options.

options.text: A - Fusiform,  radish; B - Napiform, turmeric; C - Tuberous, sweet potato
A - Conical, turnip; B - Nodulated, sweet potato; C - Tuberous, Curcuma amada
A - Conical, carrot; B - Tuberous, sweet potato; C - Fasciculated, Dahlia
A - Napiform, carrot; b - Nodulated, Tamarind; C - Tuberous, turmeric

solution.text:
Conical roots are conical in shape (widest at the top, tapering smoothly towards the bottom), e.g., carrot (Daucuscarota).

Tuberous roots become fleshy and tuberous as a result of food storage, e.g., sweet potato (Ipomoea batata).

Fasciculated roots are produced from one place forming a tuft or cluster. In Dahlia, the clusters of modified adventitious roots are formed at the base of the stem.
